member.name: T:Terraria.Audio.GStreamerAudioSupport
member.summary:
We require a WMAUDIO2/wmav2 decoder to read the windows wavebank. FFMPEG has the only one available to us. GStreamer replaces FFMPEG support in the latest FAudio releases. Unfortunately GStreamer just ends up using FFMPEG as a backend to the gstlibav.dll plugin anyway Slimming the FFMPEG for GStreamer would _probably_ require rebuilding the gstlibav plugin, or writing our own.
If we ever need GStreamer support for FAudio in the future... add the following directory structure to Libraries/Native/Windows gstreamer │ avcodec-58.dll │ avfilter-7.dll │ avformat-58.dll │ avutil-56.dll │ bz2.dll │ ffi-7.dll │ glib-2.0-0.dll │ gmodule-2.0-0.dll │ gobject-2.0-0.dll │ gstapp-1.0-0.dll │ gstaudio-1.0-0.dll │ gstbase-1.0-0.dll │ gstpbutils-1.0-0.dll │ gstreamer-1.0-0.dll │ gsttag-1.0-0.dll │ gstvideo-1.0-0.dll │ intl-8.dll │ libwinpthread-1.dll │ orc-0.4-0.dll │ swresample-3.dll │ z-1.dll │ └───plugins gstapp.dll gstaudioconvert.dll gstaudioresample.dll gstcoreelements.dll gstlibav.dll gstplayback.dll

member.summary: Call this before loading the FAudio dll

member.summary:
This data type describes in detail how a sound should be played.
Passable to the method.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.SoundPath
member.summary: The sound effect to play.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.Type
member.summary:
Controls which volume setting will this be affected by.
Ambience sounds also don't play when the game is out of focus.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.Identifier
member.summary: If defined, this string will be the only thing used to determine which styles should instances be shared with.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.MaxInstances
member.summary:
The max amount of sound instances that this style will allow creating, before stopping a playing sound or refusing to play a new one.
Set to 0 for no limits.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.SoundLimitBehavior
member.summary: Determines what the action taken when the max amount of sound instances is reached.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.PlayOnlyIfFocused
member.summary: If true, this sound won't play if the game's window isn't selected.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.IsLooped
member.summary: Whether or not to loop played sounds.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.UsesMusicPitch
member.summary:
Whether or not this sound obeys the field to decide its pitch.
Defaults to false. Used in vanilla by the sounds for the Bell, the (Magical) Harp, and The Axe.
Could prove useful, but is kept internal for the moment.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.Variants
member.summary:
An array of possible suffixes to randomly append to after .
Setting this property resets .

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.VariantsWeights
member.summary:
An array of randomization weights to optionally go with .
Set this last, if at all, as the 's setter resets all weights data.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.Volume
member.summary: The volume multiplier to play sounds with.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.Pitch
member.summary:
The pitch offset to play sounds with.
In XNA and FNA, Pitch ranges from -1.0f (down one octave) to 1.0f (up one octave). 0.0f is unity (normal) pitch.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.PitchVariance
member.summary:
The pitch offset randomness value. Cannot be negative.
With Pitch at 0.0, and PitchVariance at 1.0, used pitch will range from -0.5 to 0.5.
In XNA and FNA, Pitch ranges from -1.0f (down one octave) to 1.0f (up one octave). 0.0f is unity (normal) pitch.

member.name: P:Terraria.Audio.SoundStyle.PitchRange
member.summary:
A helper property for controlling both Pitch and PitchVariance at once.
In XNA and FNA, Pitch ranges from -1.0f (down one octave) to 1.0f (up one octave). 0.0f is unity (normal) pitch.

member.name: M:Terraria.GameContent.Drawing.TileDrawing.EmitLivingTreeLeaf(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Emits a single living tree leaf or other gore instance directly below the target tile.
With a 50% chance, also emits a second leaf or other gore instance directly to the side of the target tile, dependent on wind direction.
Used by vanilla's two types of Living Trees, from which this method and its two submethods get their collective name.
member.param: The X coordinate of the target tile.
The Y coordinate of the target tile.
The numerical ID of the leaf or other gore instance that should be spawned.

The numerical ID of the leaf or other gore instance that should be spawned.

member.param: The X coordinate of the target tile.

member.summary: Fetches the degree to which wind would/should affect a tile at the given location.
member.param: The X coordinate of the theoretical target tile.
The Y coordinate of the theoretical target tile.
member.returns:
If is false or the tile is below surface level, 0.

member.name: M:Terraria.GameContent.Drawing.TileDrawing.ShouldSwayInWind(System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.Tile)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the tile at the given location should be able to sway in the wind.
member.param: The X coordinate of the given tile.
The Y coordinate of the given tile.
The tile to determine the sway-in-wind-ability of.
member.returns:
False if something dictates that the tile should NOT be able to sway in the wind; returns true by default.
Vanilla conditions that prevent wind sway are, in this order:
- if is false
- if is false for the tile type of
- if the tile is an Orange Bloodroot - if the tile is a Pink Prickly Pear on any vanilla cactus variant

member.name: M:Terraria.GameContent.UI.BigProgressBar.BigProgressBarSystem.TryGetSpecialVanillaBossBar(System.Int32,Terraria.GameContent.UI.BigProgressBar.IBigProgressBar@)
member.summary:
Gets the special IBigProgressBar associated with this vanilla NPCs netID (usually the type).
Reminder: If no special bar exists or NPC.BossBar is not assigned, any NPC with a boss head index will automatically display a common boss bar shared among all simple bosses.
member.param: The NPC netID (usually the type)
When this method returns, contains the IBigProgressBar associated with the specified NPC netID
member.returns: if IBigProgressBar exists; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Terraria.GameInput.PlayerInput.LockVanillaMouseScroll(System.String)
member.summary: Locks the vanilla scrollbar for the upcoming cycle when called. Autoclears in Player. Takes a string to denote that your UI has registered to lock vanilla scrolling. String does not need to be unique.

如果您的宝藏袋是困难模式前的，请同时设置 。

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.ItemID.Sets.PreHardmodeLikeBossBag
member.summary:
为困难模式前的宝藏袋设置，除外还包含史莱姆皇后的宝藏袋。影响开发者套装掉落功能的方式，使其只掉落在特殊的世界种子中。
别忘记同时设置

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.ItemID.Sets.CatchingTool
member.summary:
Set for catching tools (bug net-type items which can catch critters).
If you want your catching tool to be able to catch the Underworld's lava critters, don't forget to use the set in conjunction with this one.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.ItemID.Sets.LavaproofCatchingTool
member.summary:
Set for catching tools which can catch the Underworld's lava critters.
Don't forget to use the set in conjunction with this one.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.ItemID.Sets.Spears
member.summary:
Set for easily defining weapons as spears.
Only used for vanilla spears to make sure they still scale with attack speed (though it's encouraged to set this for your spears as well, for cross-mod support).

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.NPCID.Sets.SpawnFromLastEmptySlot
member.summary: Whether or not the spawned NPC will start looking for a suitable slot from the end of , ignoring the Start parameter of . Useful if you have a multi-segmented boss and want its parts to draw over the main body (body will be in this set).

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.NPCID.Sets.ActsLikeTownNPC
member.summary: Whether or not a given NPC will act like a town NPC in terms of AI, animations, and attacks, but not in other regards, such as having a happiness button or appearing on the minimap, like the bone merchant in vanilla.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.NPCID.Sets.SpawnsWithCustomName
member.summary: Whether or not a given NPC will spawn with a custom name like a town NPC. In order to determine what name will be selected, override the TownNPCName hook. True will force a name to be rolled regardless of vanilla behavior. False will have vanilla handle the naming.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.NPCID.Sets.CannotSitOnFurniture
member.summary: Whether or not a given NPC can sit on suitable furniture ()

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.NPCID.Sets.CannotDropSouls
member.summary:
Whether or not a given NPC is excluded from dropping hardmode souls (Soul of Night/Light)
Contains vanilla NPCs that are easy to spawn in large numbers, preventing easy soul farming
Do not add your NPC to this if it would be excluded automatically (i.e. critter, town NPC, or no coin drops)

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.NPCID.Sets.AllowDoorInteraction
member.summary: Whether or not this NPC can still interact with doors if they use the Vanilla TownNPC aiStyle (AKA aiStyle == 7) but are not actually marked as Town NPCs (AKA npc.townNPC == true).
member.remarks: Note: This set DOES NOT DO ANYTHING if your NPC doesn't use the Vanilla TownNPC aiStyle (aiStyle == 7).

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.ProjectileID.Sets.TrailingMode
member.summary:
Determines what data will be remembered for projectile trails. Each projectile type defaults to -1, meaning no information is saved. Use values of 0 or 2 most of the time.
0: only position data is remembered.
1: should not be used.
2: position, rotation, and spriteDirection data is remembered
3: same as 2, but attempts to smooth out old data by interpolating values
4: same as 2, but adjusts old data to follow the player owner.
Must be used with , , , to be used properly.
Refer to ExampleBullet in ExampleMod for sample usage.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.ProjectileID.Sets.TrailCacheLength
member.summary: The length of the the trail to store. Each projectile type defaults to 10. Use for drawing trails. Must be used with to be used properly.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.CanBeSloped
member.summary: Allows non-solid tiles to be sloped (solid tiles can always be sloped, regardless of this set).

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.IgnoredByNpcStepUp
member.summary:
Whether or not the tile will be ignored for automatic step up regarding town NPC collision.
Only checked when with specialChecksMode set to 1 is called

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.DisableSmartCursor
member.summary: Whether or not the smart cursor function is disabled when the cursor hovers above this tile.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.DisableSmartInteract
member.summary: Whether or not the smart tile interaction function is disabled when the cursor hovers above this tile.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.IsValidSpawnPoint
member.summary: Whether or not this tile is a valid spawn point.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.Torch
member.summary: Whether or not this tile behaves like a torch. If you are making a torch tile, then setting this to true is necessary in order for tile placement, tile framing, and the item's smart selection to work properly.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.Clock
member.summary: Whether or not this tile is a clock.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.TreeSapling
member.summary: Whether or not this tile is a sapling, which can grow into a tree based on the soil it's placed on. Be sure to set with this too.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.CountsAsWaterSource
member.summary: Whether or not this tile counts as a water source for crafting purposes.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.CountsAsHoneySource
member.summary: Whether or not this tile counts as a honey source for crafting purposes.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.CountsAsLavaSource
member.summary: Whether or not this tile counts as a lava source for crafting purposes.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.IgnoredByGrowingSaplings
member.summary: Whether or not saplings count this tile as empty when trying to grow.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.PreventsSandfall
member.summary: Whether or not this tile will prevent sand/slush from falling beneath it.
member.remarks: Note: This Set does not include the values within the Sets , , and , but Tile IDs within those sets will also prevent sandfall.

member.name: F:Terraria.ID.TileID.Sets.CountsAsPylon
member.summary: What tiles count as Pylons, which allow the player to teleport to any other valid Pylons on the map.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.cachedItemSpawnsByType
member.summary:
The number of cached item spawns by type.
A value of -1 means that an item type is not being cached.
See and for more info.
Indexed by .Defaults to -1.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.potionDelay
member.summary:
The default cooldown, in ticks, of most healing items.
This value is never changed. For creating a Philosopher's Stone-like item, see or .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.restorationDelay
member.summary:
The default cooldown, in ticks, of Restoration Potions.
This value is never changed. For creating a Philosopher's Stone-like item, see or .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.mushroomDelay
member.summary:
The default cooldown, in ticks, of Mushrooms.
This value is never changed. For creating a Philosopher's Stone-like item, see or .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.questItem
member.summary:
If true, categorizes the given item as a quest fish.
Quest fish get a special tooltip, their own category in the Research Menu, and cannot be auto-moved to the Void Vault when picked up.
If you'd like to make a quest fish, see .
If you'd just like to emulate the one-per-inventory behavior of quest fish, see .
Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.headType
member.summary:
An array for converting an value into a value.
Indexed by . Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.bodyType
member.summary:
An array for converting an value into a value.
Indexed by . Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.legType
member.summary:
An array for converting an value into a value.
Indexed by . Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.staff
member.summary:
If true, categorizes the given item type as a staff.
Staffs are held differently when their is , but are otherwise no different than any other item.
Indexed by . Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.claw
member.summary:
If true, categorizes the given item type as a claw.
Claws are held differently when their is , but are otherwise no different than any other item.
Used exclusively by the Bladed Glove in vanilla.
Indexed by . Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.mech
member.summary:
If true, then the given item will show all placed wires and actuators when held.
This item will also be grouped with other items with mech set to when the inventory is sorted.
Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.noGrabDelay
member.summary:
The delay, in ticks, before players can pick up this item.
Usually set to 100 (approximately 1.666... seconds) whenever an item is dropped.
Set to 0 whenever an item drops from a projectile.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.beingGrabbed
member.summary:
If true, then this item is currently being grabbed by a player.
Items being grabbed by the player cannot combine with nearby items, be picked up by enemies, burn in lava, or despawn.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.timeSinceItemSpawned
member.summary:
A value that increases every tick an item is in the world.
Defaults to the value in when an item is created, and increases by every tick.
When creating new items, items with a high timeSinceItemSpawned value will be replaced if no empty item slots are available.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.tileWand
member.summary:
该物品在使用时消耗的物品的数字ID。
如果大于 0，除非玩家拥有相应的物品，否则无法使用该物品。在物品栏中该物品会显示玩家具有其消耗物品的数量
默认为 -1

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.wornArmor
member.summary:
If true, then this item is in the local player's armor slots.
This causes the item to gain the set bonus tooltip if isn't an empty string.
Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.tooltipContext
member.summary:
The context in which this item's tooltip is being drawn.
See for more details.
Defaults to -1.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.dye
member.summary:
The numerical ID of the armor shader in this item activates when worn in a dye slot.
If greater than 0, then this item can be equipped into dye slots.
Defaults to -1.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.fishingPole
member.summary:
The numerical value this item adds to a player's fishing skill when held.
If greater than 0, categorizes this item as a fishing pole.
Fishing poles can be placed into weapon racks, have a counter for the bait the player is carrying, and are held out when a bobber is active.
Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.bait
member.summary:
The numerical value this item adds to a player's fishing skill when used as bait.
If greater than 0, categorizes this item as bait.
Bait can be put into ammo slots and is consumed when fishing.
The higher the value of bait, the lower the chance the bait is consumed.
Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.coinGrabRange
member.summary:
The additional distance, in pixels, that coins may be grabbed from if the player has the Gold Ring or its upgrades ().
Applies to , , , and .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.manaGrabRange
member.summary:
The additional distance, in pixels, that mana stars may be grabbed from if the player has the Celestial Magnet or its upgrades ().
Applies to , , and .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.lifeGrabRange
member.summary:
The additional distance, in pixels, that mana stars may be grabbed from if the player has consumed a Heartreach Potion ().
Applies to , , and .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.treasureGrabRange
member.summary: The additional distance, in pixels, that items may be grabbed from if the player has equipped a Treasure Magnet ().

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.makeNPC
member.summary:
The numerical ID of the NPC that this item creates when used.
Mainly used for caught critters as items so that they can be released into the world.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.expertOnly
member.summary:
If true, then the given item's effects only function in Expert Mode or higher ().
Specifically, any equipped, Expert-only accessory will not update, any Expert-only minecart will not be used when riding minecart tracks, and an 'X' will be drawn over the item when equipped.
Unused in vanilla.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.expert
member.summary:
If true, then the given item is automatically given the Expert rarity, causing its name to be drawn in rainbow text.
It also adds the "Expert" tooltip. To use the Expert rarity without adding this tooltip, see .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.masterOnly
member.summary:
If true, then the given item's effects only function in Master Mode or higher ().
Specifically, any equipped, Master-only accessory will not update, any Master-only minecart will not be used when riding minecart tracks, and an 'X' will be drawn over the item when equipped.
Unused in vanilla.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.master
member.summary:
If true, then the given item is automatically given the Master rarity, causing its name to be drawn in red-orange text.
It also adds the "Master" tooltip. To use the Master rarity without adding this tooltip, see .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.isAShopItem
member.summary:
If true, then the given item is being sold in a shop.
Shop items display their price. See .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.paint
member.summary:
The numerical ID of the paint applied by this item when used with a paint brush or paint roller.
For conversion into a shader index, see .
For more details regarding paint, see and .
Defaults to 0.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.instanced
member.summary:
If true, then the given item is instanced per-client.
Instanced items only appear on the client they were spawned on and are less likely to be replaced if a new item is spawned.
Instanced items do not exist on servers.
Vanilla uses this field for treasure bags and Defender Medals. tModLoader automatically handles this for modded treasure bags.
If you would like to make an instanced item, see any one of the following for examples:
-
-
-
Defaults to false.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.favorited
member.summary:
If true, then the given item is favorited.
Favorited items cannot be dropped, automatically moved into chests, placed in any kind of item rack, sold, trashed, or sorted.
Favorited items can still be dropped if the player has no inventory space and will still drop on death on Mediumcore or higher difficulties.
An item becomes unfavorited if removed from the player's inventory, including if the item is move to any equipment slot.
Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.uniqueStack
member.summary:
Players cannot pick up a uniqueStack item if they have an item with the same in their inventory.
This does not apply to equipped items, nor does it apply to items held with the mouse ().
This field only prevents picking items up: Multiple uniqueStack items may still be transferred into the player's inventory from chests.
Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.shopSpecialCurrency
member.summary:
The numerical ID of the special currency this item is bought using.
To make an item bought using Defender Medals, set this to .
Defaults to -1, which means an item is bought using coins.

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.shopCustomPrice
member.summary:
If not , the custom value of the given item when being bought from a shop.
Used for assigning a non-default price to an item in shops.
To get the raw price of an item, use .
To get the price of an item after discounts, use .
Defaults to .

member.name: F:Terraria.Item.DD2Summon
member.summary:
If true, the given item is categorized as a Dungeon Defenders 2 summon item.
DD2 summon items get a counter for how much Etherian Mana is in the player's inventory.
This field being set does not make the item consume Etherian Mana. Etherian Mana consumption is handled manually per-type.
Defaults to .

member.name: M:Terraria.Item.DefaultToPlacableWall(System.UInt16)
member.summary:
This method sets a variety of common Item values common to placeable walls.
Specifically: useStyle = 1; useTurn = true; useAnimation = 15; useTime = 7; autoReuse = true; maxStack = 999; consumable = true; createWall = wallToPlace; width = 12; height = 12;

M:Terraria.Item.DefaultToRangedWeapon(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This method sets a variety of common Item values common to ranged weapons.
Specifically: autoReuse = hasAutoReuse; useStyle = 5; useAnimation = singleShotTime; useTime = singleShotTime; shoot = baseProjType; useAmmo = ammoID; shootSpeed = shotVelocity; noMelee = true; ranged = true;

member.name: M:Terraria.Item.NewItem(Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This particular overload uses a Vector2 instead of X and Y to determine the actual spawn position.

member.name: M:Terraria.Item.NewItem(Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Spawns an item into the game world with the given type and stack size. The X, Y, Width, and Height parameters dictate a rectangle, the item will be spawned centered within that rectangle. Other overloads support passing in a position directly, or just use 0 for Width and Height if the center is passed in a X and Y. This method should not be called on multiplayer clients. If you need to spawn items from client code, use instead, it handles the multiplayer syncing code needed. The source represents the entity causing this item to spawn. The return value is the index of the spawned Item within the array.
member.param: Either an entry or , for example or ModContent.ItemType<MyModItem>()
Item stack

member.name: P:Terraria.Item.attackSpeedOnlyAffectsWeaponAnimation
member.summary:
Dictates whether or not attack speed modifiers on this weapon will actually affect its use time.
Defaults to false, which allows attack speed modifiers to affect use time. Set this to true to prevent this from happening.
Used in vanilla by all melee weapons which shoot a projectile and have set to false.

member.name: P:Terraria.Item.AllowReforgeForStackableItem
member.summary:
Set to true in SetDefaults to allow this item to receive a prefix on reforge even if maxStack is not 1.
This prevents it from receiving a prefix on craft.

member.name: P:Terraria.Item.useLimitPerAnimation
member.summary:
Dictates the amount of times a weapon can be used (shot, etc) each time it animates (is swung, clicked, etc).
Defaults to null.
Used in vanilla by the following:
- BookStaff
- FairyQueenMagicItem
- FairyQueenRangedItem

member.name: P:Terraria.Item.consumeAmmoOnFirstShotOnly
member.summary:
Dictates whether or not this item should only consume ammo on its first shot of each use.
Defaults to false.
Used in vanilla by the following:
- Flamethrower
- Elf Melter

member.name: P:Terraria.Item.consumeAmmoOnLastShotOnly
member.summary:
Dictates whether or not this item should only consume ammo on its last shot of each use.
Defaults to false.
Used in vanilla by the following:
- ClockworkAssaultRifle
- Clentaminator
- FairyQueenRangedItem

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.persistentBuff
member.summary:
Allows status effects for which this is set to true to persist after the afflicted player's death.
Defaults to false; all vanilla flask effects have their entries here set to true.

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.vanityPet
member.summary:
Categorizes status effects for which this is set to true as being from vanity pets, preventing them from overlapping with other vanity pet status effects.
Defaults to false; all vanilla vanity pets have their entries here set to true.

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.lightPet
member.summary:
Categorizes status effects for which this is set to true as being tied to a light pet, preventing them from overlapping with other light pet status effects.
Defaults to false; all vanilla light pets have their entries here set to true.

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.meleeBuff
member.summary:
Categorizes status effects for which this is set to true as being from flasks, preventing them from overlapping with other flask status effects.
Defaults to false; all vanilla flask effects have their entries here set to true.

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.debuff
member.summary:
Categorizes status effects for which this is set to true as being debuffs instead of buffs.
This has multiple effects on gameplay:
- the Nurse can remove the status effect when healing the afflicted player (to prevent this, refer to )
- the status effect cannot be cleared from overflowing the status effect cap (buffs will be cleared instead)
- the status effect cannot be cleared by right-clicking it (which can be done for all other status effect types)
Defaults to false; all vanilla debuffs have their entries here set to true.

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.buffNoTimeDisplay
member.summary:
Prevents status effects which have their entries set to true from displaying the amount of time they have left.
Defaults to false; most, if not all, status effects which have their entries set to true here are related to mounts, pets, and summons.

member.name: F:Terraria.Main.npcCatchable
member.summary:
Used to denote an NPC as being catchable by bug nets and similar.
Contrary to its name, this array isn't actually used for catching logic at all.
It is instead used to determine if an NPC can be released back into the world after being caught.

member.name: P:Terraria.Main.MouseScreen
member.summary:
Fetches the position of the mouse cursor on the screen.
Useful for making things visually happen near the cursor.

member.name: P:Terraria.Main.MouseWorld
member.summary:
Fetches the position of the mouse cursor in the world.
Useful for making things functionally happen near the cursor, such as projectile or NPC spawns.

member.name: M:Terraria.Main.StopRain
member.summary:
Stops rain. Should be called on the server (netMode != client) - vanilla syncs it using .
You can also call this on the client to update visuals immediately, assuming it was called serverside aswell (Journey Mode rain slider does this).

member.name: M:Terraria.Main.StartRain
member.summary:
Starts rain for a random amount of time. Should be called on the server (netMode != client) - vanilla syncs it using .
You can also call this on the client to update visuals immediately, assuming it was/will be called serverside aswell (Journey Mode rain slider does this).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.BossBarLoader.DrawFancyBar_TML(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Terraria.DataStructures.BossBarDrawParams)
member.summary:
Draws a healthbar with fixed barTexture dimensions (516x348) where the effective bar top left starts at 32x24, and is 456x22 big
The icon top left starts at 4x20, and is 26x28 big
Frame 0 contains the frame (outline)
Frame 1 contains the 2 pixel wide strip for the tip of the bar itself
Frame 2 contains the 2 pixel wide strip for the bar itself, stretches out
Frame 3 contains the background
Frame 4 contains the 2 pixel wide strip for the tip of the bar itself (optional shield)
Frame 5 contains the 2 pixel wide strip for the bar itself, stretches out (optional shield)
Supply your own textures if you need a different shape/color, otherwise you can make your own method to draw it
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The draw parameters for the boss bar

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.BackgroundColorAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a background color to be used for the property, field, or class in the ModConfig UI.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.SliderColorAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a slider color for ModConfig elements that use a slider. The default color is white.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ReloadRequiredAttribute
member.summary: This attribute hints that changing the value of the annotated property or field will put the config in a state that requires a reload. An overridden ModConfig.NeedsReload can further validate if more complex logic is needed.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.LabelAttribute
member.summary: This attribute sets a label for the property, field, or class for use in the ModConfig UI. Starting the label with $ means the label should be interpreted as a Localization key.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.TooltipAttribute
member.summary: This attribute sets a hover tooltip for the annotated property or field to be shown in the ModConfig UI. This can be longer and more descriptive than Label. Starting the tooltip with $ means the tooltip should be interpreted as a Localization key.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.HeaderAttribute
member.summary: This attribute adds a label above this property or field in the ModConfig UI that acts as a header. Use this to delineate sections within your config. Note that fields will be in order, and properties will be in order, but fields and properties will not be interleaved together in the source code order.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.CustomModConfigItemAttribute
member.summary: Use this attribute to specify a custom UI element to be used for the annotated property, field, or class in the ModConfig UI.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.JsonDefaultValueAttribute
member.summary: Similar to DefaultValueAttribute but for reference types. It uses a json string that will be used populate this element when initialized. Defines the default value, expressed as json, to be used to populate an object with the NullAllowed attribute. Modders should only use this in conjuction with NullAllowed, as simply initializing the field with a default value is preferred.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.DefaultListValueAttribute
member.summary: Defines the default value to be added when using the ModConfig UI to add elements to a Collection (List, Set, or Dictionary value). Works the same as System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute, but can't inherit from it because it would break when deserializing any data structure annotated with it.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.DefaultDictionaryKeyValueAttribute
member.summary: Defines the default key value to be added when using the ModConfig UI to add elements to a Dictionary. Works the same as System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute, but can't inherit from it because it would break when deserializing any data structure annotated with it. This attribute compliments DefaultListValueAttribute when used annotating a Dictionary.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.JsonDefaultListValueAttribute
member.summary: Similar to DefaultListValueAttribute but for reference types. It uses a json string that will be used populate new instances list elements. Defines the default value, expressed as json, to be added when using the ModConfig UI to add elements to a Collection (List, Set, or Dictionary value).

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.JsonDefaultDictionaryKeyValueAttribute
member.summary: Similar to JsonDefaultListValueAttribute, but for assigning to the Dictionary Key rather than the Value.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.OptionStringsAttribute
member.summary: By default, string fields will provide the user with a text input field. Use this attribute to restrict strings to a selection of options.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.IncrementAttribute
member.summary: Use this to set an increment for sliders. The slider will move by the amount assigned. Remember that this is just a UI suggestion and manual editing of config files can specify other values, so validate your values. Defaults are: float: 0.01f - byte/int/uint: 1

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.RangeAttribute
member.summary: Specifies a range for primitive data values. Without this, default min and max are as follows: float: 0, 1 - int/uint: 0, 100 - byte: 0, 255

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.SliderAttribute
member.summary: Affects whether this data will be presented as a slider or an input field. Add this attribute to use a slider. Currently only affects data of type int.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.DrawTicksAttribute
member.summary: Add this attribute and the sliders will show white tick marks at each increment.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ColorNoAlphaAttribute
member.summary: Add this attribute to a Color item and Alpha will not be presented in the UI and will remain as 255 unless manually edited.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ColorHSLSliderAttribute
member.summary: Add this attribute to a Color item and the UI will present a Hue, Saturation, and Lightness sliders rather than Red, Green, and Blue sliders. Pass in false to skip Saturation and Lightness.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.SeparatePageAttribute
member.summary: This specifies that the annotated item will appear as a button that leads to a separate page in the UI. Use this to organize hierarchies.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.NullAllowedAttribute
member.summary: This attribute means the annotated item can possibly be null. This will allow the UI to make the item null. It is up to the modder to make sure the item isn't null in the ModConfig constructor and nested classes.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ReferenceDefaultsPreservingResolver
member.summary: Custom ContractResolver for facilitating refernce type defaults. The ShouldSerialize code enables unchanged-by-user reference type defaults to properly not serialize. The ValueProvider code helps during deserialization to not

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ConfigScope
member.summary: Each ModConfig class has a different scope. Failure to use the correct mode will lead to bugs.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ConfigScope.ServerSide
member.summary: This config is shared between all clients and maintained by the server. Use this for game-play changes that should affect all players the same. ServerSide also covers single player as well.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ConfigScope.ClientSide
member.summary: This config is specific to the client. Use this for personalization options.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.EntityDefinition
member.summary: Classes implementing EntityDefinition serve to function as a way to save and load the identities of various Terraria objects. Only the identity is preserved, no other data such as stack size, damage, etc. These classes are well suited for ModConfig, but can be saved and loaded in a TagCompound as well.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ItemDefinition
member.summary: ItemDefinition represents an Item identity. A typical use for this class is usage in ModConfig, perhapse to facilitate an Item tweaking mod.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ToFromStringConverter`1
member.summary: This TypeConverter facilitates converting to and from the string Type. This is necessary for Objects that are to be used as Dictionary keys, since the JSON for keys needs to be a string. Classes annotated with this TypeConverter need to implement a static FromString method that returns T.
member.typeparam: The Type that implementes the static FromString method that returns Type T.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig
member.summary: ModConfig provides a way for mods to be configurable. ModConfigs can either be Client specific or Server specific. When joining a MP server, Client configs are kept but Server configs are synced from the server. Using serialization attributes such as [DefaultValue(5)] or [JsonIgnore] are critical for proper usage of ModConfig. tModLoader also provides its own attributes such as ReloadRequiredAttribute and LabelAttribute.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig.OnLoaded
member.summary: This method is called when the ModConfig has been loaded for the first time. This happens before regular Autoloading and Mod.Load. You can use this hook to assign a static reference to this instance for easy access. tModLoader will automatically assign (and later unload) this instance to a static field named Instance in the class prior to calling this method, if it exists.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig.OnChanged
member.summary: This hook is called anytime new config values have been set and are ready to take effect. This will always be called right after OnLoaded and anytime new configuration values are ready to be used. The hook won't be called with values that violate NeedsReload. Use this hook to integrate with other code in your Mod to apply the effects of the configuration values. If your NeedsReload is correctly implemented, you should be able to apply the settings without error in this hook. Be aware that this hook can be called in-game and in the main menu, as well as in single player and multiplayer situations.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig.AcceptClientChanges(Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig,System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Called on the Server for ServerSide configs to determine if the changes asked for by the Client will be accepted. Useful for enforcing permissions. Called after a check for NeedsReload.
member.param: An instance of the ModConfig with the attempted changes
The client whoAmI
A message that will be returned to the client, set this to the reason the server rejects the changes.
member.returns: Return false to reject client changes

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig.Clone
member.summary: tModLoader will call Clone on ModConfig to facilitate proper implementation of the ModConfig user interface and detecting when a reload is required. Modders need to override this method if their config contains reference types. Failure to do so will lead to bugs. See ModConfigShowcaseDataTypes.Clone for examples and explanations.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig.NeedsReload(Terraria.ModLoader.Config.ModConfig)
member.summary: Whether or not a reload is required. The default implementation compares properties and fields annotated with the ReloadRequiredAttribute. Unlike the other ModConfig hooks, this method is called on a clone of the ModConfig that was saved during mod loading. The pendingConfig has values that are about to take effect. Neither of these instances necessarily match the instance used in OnLoaded.
member.param: The other instance of ModConfig to compare against, it contains the values that are pending to take effect

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Config.UI.ConfigElement.Bind(Terraria.ModLoader.Config.UI.PropertyFieldWrapper,System.Object,System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Bind must always be called after the ctor and serves to facilitate a convenient inheritance workflow for custom ConfigElemets from mods.

member.summary: This is the internal ID of this DamageClass.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass.ClassName
member.summary: This is the translation that is used behind . The translation will show up when an item tooltip displays 'X [ClassName]'. This should include the 'damage' part.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass.DisplayName
member.summary: This is the name that will show up when an item tooltip displays 'X [ClassName]'. This should include the 'damage' part.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass.GetModifierInheritance(Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass)
member.summary: This lets you define the classes that this DamageClass will benefit from (other than itself) for the purposes of stat bonuses, such as damage and crit chance. This returns a struct called StatInheritanceData. This is used to allow extensive specifications for what your damage class can and can't benefit from in terms of other classes' stat bonuses. By default, this will return StatInheritanceData.Full for DamageClass.Generic, and StatInheritanceData.None for any other. Any given DamageClass will also never call this method for itself. For a more in-depth explanation and demonstration, refer to ExampleMod/Content/DamageClasses/ExampleDamageClass.
member.param: The DamageClass which you want this DamageClass to benefit from statistically.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass.GetEffectInheritance(Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass)
member.summary: This lets you define the classes that this DamageClass will count as (other than itself) for the purpose of armor and accessory effects, such as Spectre armor's bolts on magic attacks, or Magma Stone's Hellfire debuff on melee attacks. Returns false in all cases by default, which does not let any other classes' effects trigger on this DamageClass. For a more in-depth explanation and demonstration, refer to ExampleMod/Content/DamageClasses/ExampleDamageClass.
member.param: The DamageClass which you want this DamageClass to gain effects from.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.DamageClass.SetDefaultStats(Terraria.Player)

member.summary: This lets you decide whether or not your damage class will use standard crit chance calculations. Setting this to false will also hide the critical strike chance line in the tooltip of any item that uses this DamageClass.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipLoader
member.summary: This serves as a central place to store equipment slots and their corresponding textures. You will use this to obtain the IDs for your equipment textures.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipLoader.GetEquipTexture(Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the equipment texture for the specified equipment type and ID.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipLoader.AddEquipTexture(Terraria.ModLoader.Mod,System.String,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType,Terraria.ModLoader.ModItem,System.String,Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture)
member.summary:
Adds an equipment texture of the specified type, internal name, and/or associated item to your mod.
If no internal name is provided, the associated item's name will be used instead.
You can then get the ID for your texture by calling EquipLoader.GetEquipTexture, and using the EquipTexture's Slot property.
If you need to override EquipmentTexture's hooks, you can specify the class of the equipment texture class.
member.remarks:
If both an internal name and associated item are provided, the EquipTexture's name will be set to the internal name, alongside the keys for the equipTexture dictionnary.
Additionally, if multiple EquipTextures of the same type are registered for the same item, the first one to be added will be the one automatically displayed on the player and mannequins.
member.param: The mod the equipment texture is from.
The equip texture.
The item.
The internal name.
The type.
The texture.
member.returns: the ID / slot that is assigned to the equipment texture.

member.param: The mod the equipment texture is from.
The name.
The type.

member.summary: Gets the slot/ID of the equipment texture corresponding to the given name. Returns -1 if no EquipTexture with the given name is found.
member.param: The mod the equipment texture is from.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.IsVanitySet(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the head armor, body armor, and leg armor textures make up a set. This hook is used for the PreUpdateVanitySet, UpdateVanitySet, and ArmorSetShadows hooks. By default this will return the same thing as the associated ModItem's IsVanitySet, or false if no ModItem is associated.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.PreUpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as the necro armor's hurt noise) when the player wears this equipment texture's vanity set. This hook is called regardless of whether the player is frozen in any way. By default this will call the associated ModItem's PreUpdateVanitySet if there is an associated ModItem.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.UpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects (such as dust) when the player wears this equipment texture's vanity set. This hook will only be called if the player is not frozen in any way. By default this will call the associated ModItem's UpdateVanitySet if there is an associated ModItem.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.ArmorSetShadows(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine special visual effects this vanity set has on the player without having to code them yourself. By default this will call the associated ModItem's ArmorSetShadows if there is an associated ModItem.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.SetMatch(System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the equipment that the player appears to be wearing. This hook will only be called for head, body and leg textures. Note that equipSlot is not the same as the item type of the armor the player will appear to be wearing. Worn equipment has a separate set of IDs. You can find the vanilla equipment IDs by looking at the headSlot, bodySlot, and legSlot fields for items, and modded equipment IDs by looking at EquipLoader. If this hook is called on body armor, equipSlot allows you to modify the leg armor the player appears to be wearing. If you modify it, make sure to set robes to true. If this hook is called on leg armor, equipSlot allows you to modify the leg armor the player appears to be wearing, and the robes parameter is useless. By default, if there is an associated ModItem, this will call that ModItem's SetMatch.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.DrawArmorColor(Terraria.Player,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@,System.Int32@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the colors in which this armor texture and surrounding accessories are drawn, in addition to which glow mask and in what color is drawn. By default this will call the associated ModItem's DrawArmorColor if there is an associated ModItem.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.ArmorArmGlowMask(Terraria.Player,System.Single,System.Int32@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify which glow mask and in what color is drawn on the player's arms. Note that this is only called for body equipment textures. By default this will call the associated ModItem's ArmorArmGlowMask if there is an associated ModItem.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.VerticalWingSpeeds(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify vertical wing speeds.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.HorizontalWingSpeeds(Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify horizontal wing speeds.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipTexture.WingUpdate(Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows for wing textures to do various things while in use. "inUse" is whether or not the jump button is currently pressed. Called when this wing texture visually appears on the player. Use to animate wings, create dusts, invoke sounds, and create lights. By default this will call the associated ModItem's WingUpdate if there is an associated ModItem.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType
member.summary: This is an enum of all the types of equipment that exist. An equipment type is defined as a type or layer of texture that is drawn on the player (for example, body and shield and wings).

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipData
member.summary: Wrapper class for a LocalizedText and visibility field that has intended use with modification of Game Tips.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipData.Mod
member.summary: The mod instance this tip belongs to. This value is null for vanilla tips.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipData.Name
member.summary: Retrieves the "name" of this GameTip, which is the Key excluding the beginning Mods.ModName.GameTips portion. For example, if the key was "Mods.ExampleMod.GameTips.ExampleTip", this would return "ExampleTip".

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipData.FullName
member.summary: Retrieves the FULL "name" of this GameTip, which includes the Mod and this tip's Name. For example, if this tip was from ExampleMod and was named "ExampleTip", this would return "ExampleMod/ExampleTip"

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipData.Hide
member.summary: Until reload, prevents this tip from ever appearing during loading screens.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID
member.summary: This class contains a more human-readable name for every single Game Tip created by Vanilla.

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.UseSafeOrPiggyBank
member.summary: "Other players can loot your chests! If you don't trust them, use a Safe or Piggy Bank; those items have storage that is exclusive to each player."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.InfoAccessoriesInInventory
member.summary: "Info accessories don't need to be equipped to provide you and nearby friends with useful information; you can just leave them in your Inventory."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.RopeAndRopeCoils
member.summary: "Rope can really help you get around while exploring caves. You can even craft it into a Rope Coil which can be thrown and automatically unfolds!"

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GlowingMushroomBiomeAndTruffles
member.summary: "Mushroom Biomes can be grown above ground as well as below. Friendly Truffles will sometimes make themselves at home in Surface Mushroom Biomes."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.SpawnPointSettingWithBed
member.summary: "You can change your spawn point by placing and using a bed."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.MagicMirror
member.summary: "If you find a Magic Mirror, you can use it to teleport back to your spawn point."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.FloatingIslandsInSky
member.summary: "There are Floating Islands in the sky."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.BoundNPCsInWorld

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.WaterBreaksFall
member.summary: "Water will break your fall."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.LavaAndObsidianSkinPotion

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.ObsidianSkullWithHellstoneOrMeteorite
member.summary: "Walking on Hellstone and Meteorite can burn you! Protect yourself by equipping an Obsidian Skull or similar accessory."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.LifeCrystalsForLifeIncrease

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.TorchesCrafting
member.summary: "Torches require Wood and Gel to craft. Gel can be obtained by defeating slimes."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.OrePickaxePowerRequirements
member.summary: "Some ores require better pickaxes to mine."

member.summary: "Bosses are easier to defeat with friends."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.BowsAndGunsNeedAmmo

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.OldManWithCurseIsClothier

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.DemolitionistNeedsExplosivesToMoveIn

member.summary: "Find a cool new Material? Want to know what you can make? Check with your friendly neighborhood Guide!"

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadQuickEquip
member.summary: "In your Inventory, you can press {InputTrigger_QuickEquip} to equip items such as armor or accessories directly to a usable slot."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadAutoSelect
member.summary: "Hold {InputTrigger_SmartSelect} to use Auto Select, a versatile feature that adapts to your environment. It will allow you to automatically hold your Torches in dark caves, Glowsticks when underwater, or even select the right tool for breaking something."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadFavoriting
member.summary: "Press {InputTriggerUI_FavoriteItem} to Favorite an item. Favorited items can no longer be sold, thrown away, or dropped. No more accidentally losing your favorite items!"

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadInventoryBuilding
member.summary: "While navigating your Inventory, press {InputTriggerUI_BuildFromInventory} while highlighting a tool or block to build directly from your Inventory."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadRadialHotbar
member.summary: "Hold {InputTrigger_RadialQuickbar} and {InputTrigger_RadialHotbar} to bring up the Radial Quickbar and Radial Hotbar menus. These will allow you to quickly access potions, mounts, and the items in your hotbar."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadControlLayouts
member.summary: "There are multiple Gamepad control layouts available in the menu. Choose from Redigit's Pick, Yoraiz0r's Pick, Xbox, Playstation, or even make your own Custom settings!"

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadCursorSnap
member.summary: "If you select DPad Cursor Snap in the Gamepad settings, you can use the DPad for improved precision when mining or building."

member.name: F:Terraria.ModLoader.GameTipID.GamePadEnemyLockOn
member.summary: "When using Gamepad, you can lock on to enemies by pressing {InputTrigger_LockOn}. Locked on targets will be marked by a spinning reticle, and long range weapons will automatically aim at your target!"

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType
member.summary: This is the superclass for GlobalTile and GlobalWall, combining common code

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.KillSound(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to customize which sound you want to play when the tile/wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the game from playing its default sound for the tile/wall. Returns true by default.
member.param: If true, the tile/wall is only partially damaged. If false, the tile/wall is fully destroyed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.NumDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change how many dust particles are created when the tile/wall at the given coordinates is hit.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.CreateDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the default type of dust created when the tile/wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the default dust (the dustType parameter) from being created. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.CanPlace(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to stop a tile/wall from being placed at the given coordinates. Return false to block the tile/wall from being placed. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.CanExplode(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Whether or not the tile/wall at the given coordinates can be killed by an explosion (ie. bombs). Returns true by default; return false to stop an explosion from destroying it.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.PreDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind the tile/wall at the given coordinates. Return false to stop the game from drawing the tile/wall normally. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.PostDraw(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of the tile/wall at the given coordinates. This can also be used to do things such as creating dust. Called on active tiles. See also ModSystem.PostDrawTiles.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.RandomUpdate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called for every tile/wall the world randomly decides to update in a given tick. Useful for things such as growing or spreading.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.PlaceInWorld(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to do something when this tile/wall is placed. Called on the local Client and Single Player.
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates. Equal to Player.tileTargetX
The y position in tile coordinates. Equal to Player.tileTargetY
The item used to place this tile/wall.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBlockType.ModifyLight(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how much light the block emits. If it is a tile, make sure you set Main.tileLighted[Type] to true in SetDefaults for this to work. If it is a wall, it can also let you light up the block in front of this wall.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBossBar
member.summary: A class that is used to modify existing boss health bars. To add them, use ModBossBar instead.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBossBar.PreDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Terraria.NPC,Terraria.DataStructures.BossBarDrawParams@)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things before the default draw code is ran. Return false to prevent drawing the bar. Returns true by default.
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The NPC this bar is focused on
The draw parameters for the boss bar
member.returns: for allowing drawing, for preventing drawing

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBossBar.PostDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Terraria.NPC,Terraria.DataStructures.BossBarDrawParams)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things after the bar has been drawn. skipped is true if you or another mod has skipped drawing the bar (possibly hiding it or in favor of new visuals).
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The NPC this bar is focused on
The draw parameters for the boss bar

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff
member.summary: This class allows you to modify the behavior of any buff in the game.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.Update(System.Int32,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make the buff with the given ID give certain effects to a player. If you remove the buff from the player, make sure the decrement the buffIndex parameter by 1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.Update(System.Int32,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make the buff with the given ID give certain effects to an NPC. If you remove the buff from the NPC, make sure to decrement the buffIndex parameter by 1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.ReApply(System.Int32,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows to you make special things happen when adding the given type of buff to a player when the player already has that buff. Return true to block the vanilla re-apply code from being called; returns false by default. The vanilla re-apply code sets the buff time to the "time" argument if that argument is larger than the current buff time. (For Mana Sickness, the vanilla re-apply code adds the "time" argument to the current buff time.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.ReApply(System.Int32,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows to you make special things happen when adding the given buff type to an NPC when the NPC already has that buff. Return true to block the vanilla re-apply code from being called; returns false by default. The vanilla re-apply code sets the buff time to the "time" argument if that argument is larger than the current buff time.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.ModifyBuffTip(System.Int32,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the tooltip that displays when the mouse hovers over the buff icon, as well as the color the buff's name is drawn in.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.CustomBuffTipSize(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2})
member.summary: If you are using the DrawCustomBuffTip hook, then you must use this hook as well. Calculate the location (relative to the origin) of the bottom-right corner of everything you will draw, and add that location to the sizes parameter.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.DrawCustomBuffTip(System.String,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to draw whatever you want when a buff tooltip is drawn. The originX and originY parameters are the top-left corner of everything that's drawn; you should add these to the position argument passed to SpriteBatch.Draw.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.PreDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.DataStructures.BuffDrawParams@)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things before the default draw code is ran. Return false to prevent drawing the buff. Returns true by default.
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The buff type
The index in Main.LocalPlayer.buffType and .buffTime of the buff
The draw parameters for the buff
member.returns: for allowing drawing, for preventing drawing

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.PostDraw(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.DataStructures.BuffDrawParams)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things after the buff has been drawn. skipped is true if you or another mod has skipped drawing the buff (possibly hiding it or in favor of new visuals).
member.param: The spriteBatch that is drawn on
The buff type
The index in Main.LocalPlayer.buffType and .buffTime of the buff
The draw parameters for the buff

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBuff.RightClick(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the buff icon is right-clicked. Return false to prevent the buff from being cancelled.
member.param: The buff type
The index in Main.LocalPlayer.buffType and .buffTime of the buff
member.returns: for allowing the buff to be cancelled, to prevent the buff from being cancelled

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalInfoDisplay
member.summary: A class that is used to modify existing info displays (i.e. the things that the Cell Phone uses to communicate information). All vanilla displays can be accessed using InfoDisplay.(name of item).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalInfoDisplay.Active(Terraria.ModLoader.InfoDisplay)
member.summary: Allows you to modify whether or not a given InfoDisplay is active. Returns null (no change from default behavior) by default for all InfoDisplays.
member.param: The display you're deciding the active state for.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalInfoDisplay.ModifyDisplayName(Terraria.ModLoader.InfoDisplay,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the display name of an InfoDisplay (shown when hovering over said display in-game).

The display name of the current display.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalInfoDisplay.ModifyDisplayValue(Terraria.ModLoader.InfoDisplay,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the display value (the text displayed next to the icon) of an InfoDisplay.
member.param: The display you're modifying the display value for.
The

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem
member.summary: This class allows you to modify and use hooks for all items, including vanilla items. Create an instance of an overriding class then call Mod.AddGlobalItem to use this.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.SetDefaults(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to set the properties of any and every item that gets created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnSpawn(Terraria.Item,Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource)
member.summary: Gets called when any item spawns in world

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ChoosePrefix(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary: Allows you to manually choose what prefix an item will get.
member.returns: The ID of the prefix to give the item, -1 to use default vanilla behavior

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.PrefixChance(Terraria.Item,System.Int32,Terraria.Utilities.UnifiedRandom)
member.summary:
To prevent putting the item in the tinkerer slot, return false when pre is -3. To prevent rolling of a prefix on spawn, return false when pre is -1. To force rolling of a prefix on spawn, return true when pre is -1.
To reduce the probability of a prefix on spawn (pre == -1) to X%, return false 100-4X % of the time. To increase the probability of a prefix on spawn (pre == -1) to X%, return true (4X-100)/3 % of the time.
To delete a prefix from an item when the item is loaded, return false when pre is the prefix you want to delete. Use AllowPrefix to prevent rolling of a certain prefix.
member.param: The prefix being applied to the item, or the roll mode. -1 is when the item is naturally generated in a chest, crafted, purchased from an NPC, looted from a grab bag (excluding presents), or dropped by a slain enemy (if it's spawned with prefixGiven: -1). -2 is when the item is rolled in the tinkerer. -3 determines if the item can be placed in the tinkerer slot.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.AllowPrefix(Terraria.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: Force a re-roll of a prefix by returning false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanUseItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Returns whether or not any item can be used. Returns true by default. The inability to use a specific item overrides this, so use this to stop an item from being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanAutoReuseItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the autoswing (auto-reuse) behavior of any item without having to mess with Item.autoReuse.
Useful to create effects like the Feral Claws which makes melee weapons and whips auto-reusable.
Return true to enable autoswing (if not already enabled through autoReuse), return false to prevent autoswing. Returns null by default, which applies vanilla behavior.
member.param: The item.
The player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseStyle(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the location and rotation of any item in its use animation.
member.param: The item.
The player.
The source rectangle for the held item's texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.HoldStyle(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the location and rotation of the item the player is currently holding.
member.param: The item.
The player.
The source rectangle for the held item's texture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.HoldItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the player is holding an item (for example, torches make light and water candles increase spawn rate).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseTimeMultiplier(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to change the effective useTime of an item.
Note that this hook may cause items' actions to run less or more times than they should per a single use.
member.returns: The multiplier on the usage time. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item use's length.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseAnimationMultiplier(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to change the effective useAnimation of an item.
Note that this hook may cause items' actions to run less or more times than they should per a single use.
member.returns: The multiplier on the animation time. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the item animation's length.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseSpeedMultiplier(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to safely change both useTime and useAnimation while keeping the values relative to each other.
Useful for status effects.
member.returns: The multiplier on the use speed. 1f by default. Values greater than 1 increase the overall item speed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.GetHealLife(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of life a life healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healLife value.
member.param: The item being used.
The player using the item.
Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of life being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.GetHealMana(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana a mana healing item will heal for, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a healMana value.
member.param: The item being used.
The player using the item.
Whether the item is being used through quick heal or not.
The amount of mana being healed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ModifyManaCost(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to temporarily modify the amount of mana an item will consume on use, based on player buffs, accessories, etc. This is only called for items with a mana value.
member.param: The item being used.
The player using the item.
Used for decreasingly stacking buffs (most common). Only ever use -= on this field.
Use to directly multiply the item's effective mana cost. Good for debuffs, or things which should stack separately (eg meteor armor set bonus).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnMissingMana(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player doesn't have enough mana for an item they are trying to use. If the player has high enough mana after this hook runs, mana consumption will happen normally. Only runs once per item use.
member.param: The item being used.
The player using the item.
The mana needed to use the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnConsumeMana(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to make stuff happen when a player consumes mana on use of an item.
member.param: The item being used.
The player using the item.
The mana consumed from the player.

True if the item was completely researched, and is ready to be duplicated, false if only partially researched.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.NeedsAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Whether or not having no ammo prevents an item that uses ammo from shooting. Return false to allow shooting with no ammo in the inventory, in which case the item will act as if the default ammo for it is being used. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.PickAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Single@,Terraria.ModLoader.StatModifier@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify various properties of the projectile created by a weapon based on the ammo it is using.
member.param: The item that is using the given ammo.
The ammo item being used by the given weapon.
The player using the item.
The ID of the fired projectile.
The speed of the fired projectile.

The damage modifier for the projectile.
Total weapon damage is included as Flat damage.
Be careful not to apply flat or base damage bonuses which are already applied to the weapon.
The knockback of the fired projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanChooseAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not the given ammo item is valid for the given weapon; called on the weapon. If this, or on the ammo, returns false, then the ammo will not be valid for this weapon.
By default, returns null and allows and to decide. Return true to make the ammo valid regardless of these fields, and return false to make it invalid.
If false is returned, the , , , and hooks are never called.
member.param: The weapon that this hook is being called for.
The ammo that the weapon is attempting to select.
The player which this weapon and the potential ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanBeChosenAsAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not the given ammo item is valid for the given weapon; called on the ammo. If this, or on the weapon, returns false, then the ammo will not be valid for this weapon.
By default, returns null and allows and to decide. Return true to make the ammo valid regardless of these fields, and return false to make it invalid.
If false is returned, the , , , and hooks are never called.
member.param: The ammo that this hook is being called for.
The weapon attempting to select the ammo.
The player which the weapon and this potential ammo belong to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Whether or not the given ammo item will be consumed; called on the weapon.
By default, returns true; return false to prevent ammo consumption.
If false is returned, the and hooks are never called.
member.param: The weapon that this hook is being called for.
The ammo that the weapon is attempting to consume.
The player which this weapon and the ammo belong to.

member.summary:
Whether or not the given ammo item will be consumed; called on the ammo.
By default, returns true; return false to prevent ammo consumption.
If false is returned, the and hooks are never called.
member.param: The ammo that this hook is being called for.
The weapon attempting to consume the ammo.
The player which the weapon and this ammo belong to.

member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen when the given ammo is consumed by the given weapon. Called by the weapon.
Called before the ammo stack is reduced, and is never called if the ammo isn't consumed in the first place.
member.param: The currently-active weapon.
The ammo that the given weapon is currently using.
The player which the given weapon and the given ammo belong to.

member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen when the given ammo is consumed by the given weapon. Called by the ammo.
Called before the ammo stack is reduced, and is never called if the ammo isn't consumed in the first place.
member.param: The currently-active ammo.
The weapon that is currently using the given ammo.
The player which the given weapon and the given ammo belong to.
