member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanCatchNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine whether the given item can catch the given NPC.
Return true or false to say the given NPC can or cannot be caught, respectively, regardless of vanilla rules.
Returns null by default, which allows vanilla's NPC catching rules to decide the target's fate.
If this returns false, is never called.
NOTE: this does not classify the given item as an NPC-catching tool, which is necessary for catching NPCs in the first place.
To do that, you will need to use the "CatchingTool" set in ItemID.Sets.
member.param: The item with which the player is trying to catch the target NPC.
The NPC the player is trying to catch.
The player attempting to catch the NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnCatchNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the given item attempts to catch the given NPC.
member.param: The item used to catch the given NPC.
The NPC which the player attempted to catch.
The player attempting to catch the given NPC.
Whether or not the given NPC has been successfully caught.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ModifyItemScale(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to dynamically modify the given item's size for the given player, similarly to the effect of the Titan Glove.
member.param: The item to modify the scale of.
The player wielding the given item.

The scale multiplier to be applied to the given item.
Will be 1.1 if the Titan Glove is equipped, and 1 otherwise.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanHitNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a melee weapon can hit the given NPC when swung. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block the weapon from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that a melee weapon does to an NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnHitNPC(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a melee weapon hits an NPC (for example how the Pumpkin Sword creates pumpkin heads).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanHitPvp(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a melee weapon can hit the given opponent player when swung. Return false to block the weapon from hitting the target. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ModifyHitPvp(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that a melee weapon does to a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnHitPvp(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a melee weapon hits a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen when an item is used. The return value controls whether or not ApplyItemTime will be called for the player.
Return true if the item actually did something, to force itemTime.
Return false to keep itemTime at 0.
Return null for vanilla behavior.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseAnimation(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when an item's use animation starts.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ConsumeItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the item is consumable and this returns true, then the item will be consumed upon usage. Returns true by default. If false is returned, the OnConsumeItem hook is never called.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.OnConsumeItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this item is consumed. Called before the item stack is reduced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UseItemFrame(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the player's animation when an item is being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.HoldItemFrame(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the player's animation when the player is holding an item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.AltFunctionUse(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make an item usable by right-clicking. Returns false by default. When the item is used by right-clicking, player.altFunctionUse will be set to 2.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UpdateInventory(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when an item is in the player's inventory (for example, how the cell phone makes information display).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UpdateEquip(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to give effects to armors and accessories, such as increased damage.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UpdateAccessory(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to give effects to accessories. The hideVisual parameter is whether the player has marked the accessory slot to be hidden from being drawn on the player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UpdateVanity(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to give effects to this accessory when equipped in a vanity slot. Vanilla uses this for boot effects, wings and merman/werewolf visual flags

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.IsArmorSet(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine whether the player is wearing an armor set, and return a name for this set. If there is no armor set, return the empty string. Returns the empty string by default.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UpdateArmorSet(Terraria.Player,System.String)
member.summary:
Allows you to give set bonuses to your armor set with the given name. The set name will be the same as returned by IsArmorSet.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.IsVanitySet(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns whether or not the head armor, body armor, and leg armor textures make up a set. This hook is used for the PreUpdateVanitySet, UpdateVanitySet, and ArmorSetShadows hooks, and will use items in the social slots if they exist. By default this will return the same value as the IsArmorSet hook, so you will not have to use this hook unless you want vanity effects to be entirely separate from armor sets.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.PreUpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player,System.String)
member.summary:
Allows you to create special effects (such as the necro armor's hurt noise) when the player wears the vanity set with the given name returned by IsVanitySet. This hook is called regardless of whether the player is frozen in any way.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.UpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player,System.String)
member.summary:
Allows you to create special effects (such as dust) when the player wears the vanity set with the given name returned by IsVanitySet. This hook will only be called if the player is not frozen in any way.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ArmorSetShadows(Terraria.Player,System.String)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine special visual effects a vanity has on the player without having to code them yourself.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.SetMatch(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the equipment that the player appears to be wearing.
Note that type and equipSlot are not the same as the item type of the armor the player will appear to be wearing. Worn equipment has a separate set of IDs. You can find the vanilla equipment IDs by looking at the headSlot, bodySlot, and legSlot fields for items, and modded equipment IDs by looking at EquipLoader.
This method is not instanced.
member.param: head armor (0), body armor (1) or leg armor (2).
The equipment texture ID of the item that the player is wearing.
True if the player is male.
The altered equipment texture ID for the legs (armorSlot 1 and 2) or head (armorSlot 0)
Set to true if you modify equipSlot when armorSlot == 1 to set Player.wearsRobe, otherwise ignore it

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanRightClick(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Returns whether or not an item does something when right-clicked in the inventory. Returns false by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.RightClick(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when an item is right-clicked in the inventory. Useful for goodie bags.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanStack(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary:
Allows you to prevent items from stacking.
This is only called when two items of the same type attempt to stack.
This is usually not called for coins and ammo in the inventory/UI.
This covers all scenarios, if you just need to change in-world stacking behavior, use .
member.returns: Whether or not the items are allowed to stack

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanStackInWorld(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary:
Allows you to prevent items from stacking in the world.
This is only called when two items of the same type attempt to stack.
member.returns: Whether or not the items are allowed to stack

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.ReforgePrice(Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Returns if the normal reforge pricing is applied. If true or false is returned and the price is altered, the price will equal the altered price. The passed reforge price equals the item.value. Vanilla pricing will apply 20% discount if applicable and then price the reforge at a third of that value.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.PreReforge(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: This hook gets called when the player clicks on the reforge button and can afford the reforge. Returns whether the reforge will take place. If false is returned, the PostReforge hook is never called. Reforging preserves modded data on the item.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.PostReforge(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: This hook gets called immediately after an item gets reforged by the Goblin Tinkerer. Useful for modifying modded data based on the reforge result.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.DrawArmorColor(Terraria.ModLoader.EquipType,System.Int32,Terraria.Player,System.Single,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@,System.Int32@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary:
Allows you to modify the colors in which the player's armor and their surrounding accessories are drawn, in addition to which glow mask and in what color is drawn.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.VerticalWingSpeeds(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)

member.summary: Allows you to modify the horizontal flight speed and acceleration of wings.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.WingUpdate(System.Int32,Terraria.Player,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Allows for Wings to do various things while in use. "inUse" is whether or not the jump button is currently pressed. Called when wings visually appear on the player. Use to animate wings, create dusts, invoke sounds, and create lights. False will keep everything the same. True, you need to handle all animations in your own code.
This method is not instanced.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.Update(Terraria.Item,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize an item's movement when lying in the world. Note that this will not be called if the item is currently being grabbed by a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.CanBurnInLava(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Returns whether or not this item will burn in lava regardless of any conditions. Returns null by default (follow vanilla behaviour).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.PostUpdate(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when an item is lying in the world. This will always be called, even when the item is being grabbed by a player. This hook should be used for adding light, or for increasing the age of less valuable items.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.GrabRange(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)

Allows you to determine the offset of an item's sprite when used by the player. This is only used for items with a useStyle of 5 that aren't staves. Return null to use the item's default holdout offset; returns null by default.

member.summary:
Allows you to determine the point on an item's sprite that the player holds onto when using the item. The origin is from the bottom left corner of the sprite. This is only used for staves with a useStyle of 5. Return null to use the item's default holdout origin; returns null by default.
This method is not instanced.

If the inventory slot index is for modded slots.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalItem.AddRecipes

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalLoot
member.summary: This readonly struct is a simple shortcut for modifying global drop rules in an .

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC
member.summary: This class allows you to modify and use hooks for all NPCs, including vanilla mobs. Create an instance of an overriding class then call Mod.AddGlobalNPC to use this.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SetDefaults(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to set the properties of any and every NPC that gets created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnSpawn(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource)
member.summary: Gets called when any NPC spawns in world

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ScaleExpertStats(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SetBestiary(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.GameContent.Bestiary.BestiaryDatabase,Terraria.GameContent.Bestiary.BestiaryEntry)
member.summary: Allows you to set an NPC's information in the Bestiary.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyTypeName(Terraria.NPC,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the type name of this NPC dynamically.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyHoverBoundingBox(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the bounding box for hovering over the given NPC (affects things like whether or not its name is displayed).

The bounding box used for determining whether or not the NPC counts as being hovered over.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyTownNPCProfile(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to set the town NPC profile that a given NPC uses.
member.param: The NPC in question.
member.returns:
The profile that you want the given NPC to use.
This will only influence their choice of profile if you do not return null.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyNPCNameList(Terraria.NPC,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Allows you to modify the list of names available to the given town NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ResetEffects(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: This is where you reset any fields you add to your subclass to their default states. This is necessary in order to reset your fields if they are conditionally set by a tick update but the condition is no longer satisfied.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.PreAI(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how any NPC behaves. Return false to stop the vanilla AI and the AI hook from being run. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.AI(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how any NPC behaves. This will only be called if PreAI returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.PostAI(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how any NPC behaves. This will be called regardless of what PreAI returns.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SendExtraAI(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.ModLoader.IO.BitWriter,System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary:
Use this judiciously to avoid straining the network.
Checks and methods such as can reduce how much data must be sent for how many projectiles.
Called whenever is successfully sent, for example on projectile creation, or whenever Projectile.netUpdate is set to true in the update loop for that tick.
Can be called on both server and client, depending on who owns the projectile.
member.param: The NPC.
The compressible bit writer. Booleans written via this are compressed across all mods to improve multiplayer performance.
The writer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ReceiveExtraAI(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.ModLoader.IO.BitReader,System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary:
Use this to receive information that was sent in .
Called whenever is successfully received.
Can be called on both server and client, depending on who owns the projectile.
member.param: The NPC.
The compressible bit reader.
The reader.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.FindFrame(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the frame from an NPC's texture that is drawn, which is necessary in order to animate NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.HitEffect(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary:
Allows you to make things happen whenever an NPC is hit, such as creating dust or gores.
This hook is client side. Usually when something happens when an npc dies such as item spawning, you use NPCLoot, but you can use HitEffect paired with a check for `if (npc.life <= 0)` to do client-side death effects, such as spawning dust, gore, or death sounds.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.UpdateLifeRegen(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to make the NPC either regenerate health or take damage over time by setting npc.lifeRegen. Regeneration or damage will occur at a rate of half of npc.lifeRegen per second. The damage parameter is the number that appears above the NPC's head if it takes damage over time.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CheckActive(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Whether or not to run the code for checking whether an NPC will remain active. Return false to stop the NPC from being despawned and to stop the NPC from counting towards the limit for how many NPCs can exist near a player. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CheckDead(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Whether or not an NPC should be killed when it reaches 0 health. You may program extra effects in this hook (for example, how Golem's head lifts up for the second phase of its fight). Return false to stop the NPC from being killed. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SpecialOnKill(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to call OnKill on your own when the NPC dies, rather then letting vanilla call it on its own. Returns false by default.
member.returns: Return true to stop vanilla from calling OnKill on its own. Do this if you call OnKill yourself.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.PreKill(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether or not NPC from doing anything on death (besides die). Return false to stop the NPC from doing anything special. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnKill(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when an NPC dies (for example, setting ModSystem fields). This hook runs on the server/single player. For client-side effects, such as dust, gore, and sounds, see HitEffect

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanFallThroughPlatforms(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine how and when an NPC can fall through platforms and similar tiles.
Return true to allow an NPC to fall through platforms, false to prevent it. Returns null by default, applying vanilla behaviors (based on aiStyle and type).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanBeCaughtBy(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Allows you to determine whether the given item can catch the given NPC.
Return true or false to say the given NPC can or cannot be caught, respectively, regardless of vanilla rules.
Returns null by default, which allows vanilla's NPC catching rules to decide the target's fate.
If this returns false, is never called.
NOTE: this does not classify the given item as an NPC-catching tool, which is necessary for catching NPCs in the first place.
To do that, you will need to use the "CatchingTool" set in ItemID.Sets.
member.param: The NPC that can potentially be caught.
The item with which the player is trying to catch the given NPC.
The player attempting to catch the given NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnCaughtBy(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when the given item attempts to catch the given NPC.
member.param: The NPC which the player attempted to catch.
The player attempting to catch the given NPC.
The item used to catch the given NPC.
Whether or not the given NPC has been successfully caught.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyNPCLoot(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.ModLoader.NPCLoot)
member.summary:
Allows you to add and modify NPC loot tables to drop on death and to appear in the Bestiary.
The Basic NPC Drops and Loot 1.4 Guide explains how to use this hook to modify npc loot.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyGlobalLoot(Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalLoot)
member.summary:
Allows you to add and modify global loot rules that are conditional, i.e. vanilla's biome keys and souls.
The Basic NPC Drops and Loot 1.4 Guide explains how to use this hook to modify npc loot.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanHitPlayer(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether an NPC can hit the given player. Return false to block the NPC from hitting the target. Returns true by default. CooldownSlot determines which of the player's cooldown counters to use (-1, 0, or 1), and defaults to -1.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyHitPlayer(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that an NPC does to a player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnHitPlayer(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when an NPC hits a player (for example, inflicting debuffs).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether an NPC can hit the given friendly NPC. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block the NPC from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that an NPC does to a friendly NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnHitNPC(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when an NPC hits a friendly NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanBeHitByItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether an NPC can be hit by the given melee weapon when swung. Return true to allow hitting the NPC, return false to block hitting the NPC, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyHitByItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that an NPC takes from a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnHitByItem(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when an NPC is hit by a melee weapon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanBeHitByProjectile(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether an NPC can be hit by the given projectile. Return true to allow hitting the NPC, return false to block hitting the NPC, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.ModifyHitByProjectile(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that an NPC takes from a projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnHitByProjectile(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when an NPC is hit by a projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.StrikeNPC(Terraria.NPC,System.Double@,System.Int32,System.Single@,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to use a custom damage formula for when an NPC takes damage from any source. For example, you can change the way defense works or use a different crit multiplier. Return false to stop the game from running the vanilla damage formula; returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.BossHeadSlot(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the boss head texture used by an NPC based on its state. Set index to -1 to stop the texture from being displayed.
member.param: The index for NPCID.Sets.BossHeadTextures

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.BossHeadRotation(Terraria.NPC,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize the rotation of an NPC's boss head icon on the map.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.BossHeadSpriteEffects(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteEffects@)
member.summary: Allows you to flip an NPC's boss head icon on the map.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.GetAlpha(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the color and transparency in which an NPC is drawn. Return null to use the default color (normally light and buff color). Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.DrawEffects(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: 允许你为一个NPC添加特殊的视觉效果(比如生成粒子)或修改NPC的颜色。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.PreDraw(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind an NPC, or to modify the way the NPC is drawn. Substract screenPos from the draw position before drawing. Return false to stop the game from drawing the NPC (useful if you're manually drawing the NPC). Returns true by default.
member.param: The NPC that is being drawn
The spritebatch to draw on
The screen position used to translate world position into screen position
The color the NPC is drawn in

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.PostDraw(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of this NPC. Substract screenPos from the draw position before drawing. This method is called even if PreDraw returns false.
member.param: The NPC that is being drawn
The spritebatch to draw on
The screen position used to translate world position into screen position
The color the NPC is drawn in

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.DrawBehind(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32)
member.summary: When used in conjunction with "npc.hide = true", allows you to specify that this npc should be drawn behind certain elements. Add the index to one of Main.DrawCacheNPCsMoonMoon, DrawCacheNPCsOverPlayers, DrawCacheNPCProjectiles, or DrawCacheNPCsBehindNonSolidTiles.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.DrawHealthBar(Terraria.NPC,System.Byte,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to control how the health bar for the given NPC is drawn. The hbPosition parameter is the same as Main.hbPosition; it determines whether the health bar gets drawn above or below the NPC by default. The scale parameter is the health bar's size. By default, it will be the normal 1f; most bosses set this to 1.5f. Return null to let the normal vanilla health-bar-drawing code to run. Return false to stop the health bar from being drawn. Return true to draw the health bar in the position specified by the position parameter (note that this is the world position, not screen position).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.EditSpawnRate(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the chance of NPCs spawning around the given player and the maximum number of NPCs that can spawn around the player. Lower spawnRates mean a higher chance for NPCs to spawn.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.EditSpawnRange(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the range at which NPCs can spawn around the given player. The spawnRanges determine that maximum distance NPCs can spawn from the player, and the safeRanges determine the minimum distance.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.EditSpawnPool(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Int32,System.Single},Terraria.ModLoader.NPCSpawnInfo)
member.summary: Allows you to control which NPCs can spawn and how likely each one is to spawn. The pool parameter maps NPC types to their spawning weights (likelihood to spawn compared to other NPCs). A type of 0 in the pool represents the default vanilla NPC spawning.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SpawnNPC(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to customize an NPC (for example, its position or ai array) after it naturally spawns and before it is synced between servers and clients. As of right now, this only works for modded NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanChat(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether this NPC can talk with the player. Return true to allow talking with the player, return false to block this NPC from talking with the player, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can talk. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.GetChat(Terraria.NPC,System.String@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the chat message of any NPC that the player can talk to.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.PreChatButtonClicked(Terraria.NPC,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to determine if something can happen whenever a button is clicked on this NPC's chat window. The firstButton parameter tells whether the first button or second button (button and button2 from SetChatButtons) was clicked. Return false to prevent the normal code for this button from running. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnChatButtonClicked(Terraria.NPC,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make something happen whenever a button is clicked on this NPC's chat window. The firstButton parameter tells whether the first button or second button (button and button2 from SetChatButtons) was clicked.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SetupShop(System.Int32,Terraria.Chest,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to add items to an NPC's shop. The type parameter is the type of the NPC that this shop belongs to. Add an item by setting the defaults of shop.item[nextSlot] then incrementing nextSlot. In the end, nextSlot must have a value of 1 greater than the highest index in shop.item that contains an item. If you want to remove an item, you will have to be familiar with programming.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SetupTravelShop(System.Int32[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to add items to the traveling merchant's shop. Add an item by setting shop[nextSlot] to the ID of the item you are adding then incrementing nextSlot. In the end, nextSlot must have a value of 1 greater than the highest index in shop that represents an item ID. If you want to remove an item, you will have to be familiar with programming.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.CanGoToStatue(Terraria.NPC,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether this NPC can be telported a King or Queen statue. Return true to allow the NPC to teleport to the statue, return false to block this NPC from teleporting to the statue, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the NPC can teleport to the statue. Returns null by default.
member.param: The NPC
Whether the NPC is being teleported to a King or Queen statue.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.OnGoToStatue(Terraria.NPC,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to make things happen when this NPC teleports to a King or Queen statue. This method is only called server side.
member.param: The NPC
Whether the NPC was teleported to a King or Queen statue.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.BuffTownNPC(System.Single@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the stats of town NPCs. Useful for buffing town NPCs when certain bosses are defeated, etc.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackStrength(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the damage and knockback of a town NPC's attack before the damage is scaled. (More information on scaling in GlobalNPC.BuffTownNPCs.)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackCooldown(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the cooldown between each of a town NPC's attack. The cooldown will be a number greater than or equal to the first parameter, and less then the sum of the two parameters.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackProj(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the projectile type of a town NPC's attack, and how long it takes for the projectile to actually appear. This hook is only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 0 (throwing), 1 (shooting), or 2 (magic).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackProjSpeed(Terraria.NPC,System.Single@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the speed at which a town NPC throws a projectile when it attacks. Multiplier is the speed of the projectile, gravityCorrection is how much extra the projectile gets thrown upwards, and randomOffset allows you to randomize the projectile's velocity in a square centered around the original velocity. This hook is only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 0 (throwing), 1 (shooting), or 2 (magic).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackShoot(Terraria.NPC,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to tell the game that a town NPC has already created a projectile and will still create more projectiles as part of a single attack so that the game can animate the NPC's attack properly. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 1 (shooting).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackMagic(Terraria.NPC,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to control the brightness of the light emitted by a town NPC's aura when it performs a magic attack. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 2 (magic)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.TownNPCAttackSwing(Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine the width and height of the item a town NPC swings when it attacks, which controls the range of the NPC's swung weapon. Only used when the town NPC has an attack type of 3 (swinging).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.DrawTownAttackGun(Terraria.NPC,System.Single@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how a town NPC's weapon is drawn when the NPC is shooting (the NPC must have an attack type of 1). Scale is a multiplier for the item's drawing size, item is the ID of the item to be drawn, and closeness is how close the item should be drawn to the NPC.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.DrawTownAttackSwing(Terraria.NPC,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D@,System.Int32@,System.Single@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to customize how a town NPC's weapon is drawn when the NPC is swinging it (the NPC must have an attack type of 3). Item is the Texture2D instance of the item to be drawn (use Main.itemTexture[id of item]), itemSize is the width and height of the item's hitbox (the same values for TownNPCAttackSwing), scale is the multiplier for the item's drawing size, and offset is the offset from which to draw the item from its normal position.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.NeedSaving(Terraria.NPC)
member.summary:
Allows you to make a npc be saved even if it's not a townNPC and NPCID.Sets.SavesAndLoads[npc.type] is false.
NOTE: A town NPC will always be saved (except the Travelling Merchant that never will).
NOTE: A NPC that needs saving will not despawn naturally.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.SaveData(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary:
Allows you to save custom data for the given npc.
NOTE: The provided tag is always empty by default, and is provided as an argument only for the sake of convenience and optimization.
NOTE: Try to only save data that isn't default values.
NOTE: The npc may be saved even if NeedSaving returns false and npc is not a townNPC, if another mod returns true on NeedSaving.
member.param: The TagCompound to save data into. Note that this is always empty by default, and is provided as an argument

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalNPC.LoadData(Terraria.NPC,Terraria.ModLoader.IO.TagCompound)
member.summary: Allows you to load custom data that you have saved for the given npc.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile
member.summary: This class allows you to modify and use hooks for all projectiles, including vanilla projectiles. Create an instance of an overriding class then call Mod.AddGlobalProjectile to use this.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.SetDefaults(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to set the properties of any and every projectile that gets created.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.OnSpawn(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.DataStructures.IEntitySource)
member.summary: Gets called when any projectiles spawns in world

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.PreAI(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how any projectile behaves. Return false to stop the vanilla AI and the AI hook from being run. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.AI(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how any projectile behaves. This will only be called if PreAI returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.PostAI(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how any projectile behaves. This will be called regardless of what PreAI returns.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.SendExtraAI(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.ModLoader.IO.BitWriter,System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary:
Use this judiciously to avoid straining the network.
Checks and methods such as can reduce how much data must be sent for how many projectiles.
Called whenever is successfully sent, for example on projectile creation, or whenever Projectile.netUpdate is set to true in the update loop for that tick.
Can be called on both server and client, depending on who owns the projectile.
member.param: The projectile.
The compressible bit writer. Booleans written via this are compressed across all mods to improve multiplayer performance.
The writer.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.ReceiveExtraAI(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.ModLoader.IO.BitReader,System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary:
Use this to receive information that was sent in .
Called whenever is successfully received.
Can be called on both server and client, depending on who owns the projectile.
member.param: The projectile.
The compressible bit reader.
The reader.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.ShouldUpdatePosition(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Whether or not the given projectile should update its position based on factors such as its velocity, whether it is in liquid, etc. Return false to make its velocity have no effect on its position. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.TileCollideStyle(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine how a projectile interacts with tiles. Return false if you completely override or cancel a projectile's tile collision behavior. Returns true by default.
member.param: The projectile.
The width of the hitbox the projectile will use for tile collision. If vanilla or a mod don't modify it, defaults to projectile.width.
The height of the hitbox the projectile will use for tile collision. If vanilla or a mod don't modify it, defaults to projectile.height.
Whether or not the projectile falls through platforms and similar tiles.

Determines by how much the tile collision hitbox's position (top left corner) will be offset from the projectile's real center. If vanilla or a mod don't modify it, defaults to half the hitbox size (new Vector2(0.5f, 0.5f)).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.OnTileCollide(Terraria.Projectile,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: Allows you to determine what happens when a projectile collides with a tile. OldVelocity is the velocity before tile collision. The velocity that takes tile collision into account can be found with projectile.velocity. Return true to allow the vanilla tile collision code to take place (which normally kills the projectile). Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.PreKill(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether the vanilla code for Kill and the Kill hook will be called. Return false to stop them from being called. Returns true by default. Note that this does not stop the projectile from dying.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.Kill(Terraria.Projectile,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to control what happens when a projectile is killed (for example, creating dust or making sounds).

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.CanCutTiles(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Return true or false to specify if the projectile can cut tiles like vines, pots, and Queen Bee larva. Return null for vanilla decision.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.CutTiles(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Code ran when the projectile cuts tiles. Only runs if CanCutTiles() returns true. Useful when programming lasers and such.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.CanDamage(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Whether or not the given projectile is capable of killing tiles (such as grass) and damaging NPCs/players. Return false to prevent it from doing any sort of damage. Return true if you want the projectile to do damage regardless of the default blacklist. Return null to let the projectile follow vanilla can-damage-anything rules. This is what happens by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.MinionContactDamage(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Whether or not a minion can damage NPCs by touching them. Returns false by default. Note that this will only be used if the projectile is considered a pet.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.ModifyDamageHitbox(Terraria.Projectile,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Rectangle@)
member.summary: Allows you to change the hitbox used by a projectile for damaging players and NPCs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.ModifyDamageScaling(Terraria.Projectile,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to implement dynamic damage scaling for this projectile. For example, flails do more damage when in flight and Jousting Lance does more damage the faster the player is moving. This hook runs on the owner only.
member.param: The damage scaling

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.CanHitNPC(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.NPC)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a projectile can hit the given NPC. Return true to allow hitting the target, return false to block the projectile from hitting the target, and return null to use the vanilla code for whether the target can be hit. Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.ModifyHitNPC(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32@,System.Single@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, knockback, etc., that a projectile does to an NPC. This method is only called for the owner of the projectile, meaning that in multi-player, projectiles owned by a player call this method on that client, and projectiles owned by the server such as enemy projectiles call this method on the server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.OnHitNPC(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.NPC,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a projectile hits an NPC (for example, inflicting debuffs). This method is only called for the owner of the projectile, meaning that in multi-player, projectiles owned by a player call this method on that client, and projectiles owned by the server such as enemy projectiles call this method on the server.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.CanHitPvp(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Allows you to determine whether a projectile can hit the given opponent player. Return false to block the projectile from hitting the target. Returns true by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.ModifyHitPvp(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the damage, etc., that a projectile does to an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.OnHitPvp(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to create special effects when a projectile hits an opponent player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.GetAlpha(Terraria.Projectile,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.PreDrawExtras(Terraria.Projectile)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind a projectile. Use the Main.EntitySpriteDraw method for drawing. Returns false to stop the game from drawing extras textures related to the projectile (for example, the chains for grappling hooks), useful if you're manually drawing the extras. Returns true by default.
member.param: The projectile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.PreDraw(Terraria.Projectile,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things behind a projectile, or to modify the way the projectile is drawn. Use the Main.EntitySpriteDraw method for drawing. Return false to stop the vanilla projectile drawing code (useful if you're manually drawing the projectile). Returns true by default.
member.param: The projectile.
The color of the light at the projectile's center.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.PostDraw(Terraria.Projectile,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color)
member.summary: Allows you to draw things in front of a projectile. Use the Main.EntitySpriteDraw method for drawing. This method is called even if PreDraw returns false.
member.param: The projectile.
The color of the light at the projectile's center, after being modified by vanilla and other mods.

member.summary: When used in conjunction with "projectile.hide = true", allows you to specify that this projectile should be drawn behind certain elements. Add the index to one and only one of the lists. For example, the Nebula Arcanum projectile draws behind NPCs and tiles.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.CanUseGrapple(System.Int32,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Whether or not a grappling hook that shoots this type of projectile can be used by the given player. Return null to use the default code (whether or not the player is in the middle of firing the grappling hook). Returns null by default.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.SingleGrappleHook(System.Int32,Terraria.Player)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.UseGrapple(Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalProjectile.NumGrappleHooks(Terraria.Projectile,Terraria.Player,System.Int32@)

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon
member.summary: Global Type that exists for pylons that allows for modification of teleportation steps, map drawing, and other functionality for any pylon that exists, whether it be vanilla or modded.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon.PreDrawMapIcon(Terraria.Map.MapOverlayDrawContext@,System.String@,Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonInfo@,System.Boolean@,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Called right before both modded and vanilla pylons draw their icons on the map. Returning false will prevent the passed in icon from being drawn on the map. Returns true by default.
member.remarks: Note that if you change the value of the isNearPylon parameter, the change will cascade and all pylons following this will be affected by the change.
member.param: The current map context on which you can draw.
The text that will overlay on the mouse when the icon is being hovered over.
The pylon that is currently needing its icon to be drawn.
Whether or not the player is currently near a pylon.
The draw color of the icon. This is bright white when the player is near a Pylon, but gray and translucent otherwise.
The scale of the icon if it is NOT currently being hovered over. In vanilla, this is 1f, or 100%.
The scale of the icon if it IS currently being over. In vanilla, this is 2f, or 200%.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon.PreCanPlacePylon(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonType)
member.summary: Called right before both modded and vanilla pylons determine whether or not they can be placed. Returning false will prevent vanilla checks from taking place, forcefully preventing the pylon from being placed. Returning null will enact vanilla behavior, and returning true will make the check forcefully succeed, regardless of vanilla behavior. Returns null by default.
member.param: The current X position of where the tile in question is asking it can be placed.
The current Y position of where the tile in question is asking it can be placed.
The actual type of tile currently asking if it can be placed.
The type of pylon belonging to this tile.
member.remarks:
Note that in Multiplayer environments, this is called first on the client, and then is subsequently called & double checked on the server.
If the server disagrees with the client that the given pylon CANNOT be placed for any given reason, the server will reject the placement and subsequently break the associated tile.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon.ValidTeleportCheck_PreNPCCount(Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonInfo,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Called before Step 1 of the ValidTeleportCheck process. This is the first vanilla check that is called when the player attempts to teleport FROM or TO a Pylon. This method is called before both vanilla and modded pylons check their NPC requirements, and returning false will prevent those checks from taking place, forcefully failing the NPCCount step. Returning null will enact vanilla behavior, and returning true will make the step succeed regardless. Returns null by default.
member.remarks: Note that you may also change the the default npc count value if for some reason you wish to change the default amount of NPCs required to satisfy ALL pylons (if they adhere to what value it is).
member.param: The internal information pertaining to the current pylon being teleported to or from.
The default amount of NPCs nearby required to satisfy a VANILLA pylon.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon.ValidTeleportCheck_PreAnyDanger(Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonInfo)
member.summary: Called before Step 2 of the ValidTeleportCheck process. This is the second vanilla check that is called when the player attempts to teleport TO a Pylon. This method is called before both vanilla and modded pylons check their Danger requirements, and returning false will prevent those checks from taking place, forcefully failing the AnyDanger step. Returning null will enact vanilla behavior, and returning true will make the step succeed regardless. Returns null by default.
member.remarks: Note that it's important you put the right checks in the right ValidTeleportCheck step, as whatever one returns false (if any) will determine the error message sent to the player.
member.param: The internal information pertaining to the current pylon being teleported TO.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon.ValidTeleportCheck_PreBiomeRequirements(Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonInfo,Terraria.SceneMetrics)
member.summary: Called before Step 3 of the ValidTeleportCheck process. This is the fourth vanilla check that is called when the player attempts to teleport FROM or TO a Pylon. This method is called before both vanilla and modded pylons check their Biome requirements, and returning false will prevent those checks from taking place, forcefully failing the BiomeRequirements step. Returning null will enact vanilla behavior, and returning true will make the step succeed regardless. Returns null by default.
member.remarks: Note that it's important you put the right checks in the right ValidTeleportCheck step, as whatever one returns false (if any) will determine the error message sent to the player.
member.param: The internal information pertaining to the current pylon being teleported to or from.
The scene metrics data AT THE LOCATION of the destination pylon, NOT the player.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalPylon.PostValidTeleportCheck(Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonInfo,Terraria.GameContent.TeleportPylonInfo,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.String@)
member.summary: Called after all checks have taken place for all vanilla and modded pylons when a teleportation request is sent (AKA when the player clicks on a pylon on the map). You can (for example) use this to allow teleportation to go through even if one the normal requirements haven't been met, or vice versa; to do this, change destinationPylonValid to true or false respectively (for the given example).
member.param: The pylon information for the DESTINATION pylon.
The pylon information of the pylon the player in question is standing NEAR. This value is at its defaults if validNearbyPylonFound is false, but otherwise, will give information on the nearby pylon.
Whether or not the normal requirements were satisfied for the DESTINATION pylon. Set this to true if you want the teleportation request to succeed, false if not.
Whether or not a valid pylon near the player satisfied its normal requirements.

The localization key that will be used to sent text to the player when destinationPylonValid is false. Note that this parameter will already have a value if the method is called with destinationPylonValid being false.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalTile.AddToArray(System.Int32[]@,System.Int32)

The y position in tile coordinates.
The tile type
Chance for a worm to spawn. Value corresponds to a chance of 1 in X. Vanilla values include: Grass-400, Plants-200, Various Piles-6
Chance for a grass hopper to spawn. Value corresponds to a chance of 1 in X. Vanilla values include: Grass-100, Plants-50
Chance for a jungle grub to spawn. Value corresponds to a chance of 1 in X. Vanilla values include: JungleVines-250, JunglePlants2-40, PlantDetritus-10

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.IPylonTileEntity
member.summary: Allows Tile Entities that you want to be included in vanilla's pylon list to actually be added to the list when said TE is extended by this interface. What this means, in short, is that whenever all of the pylons are refreshed by vanilla, Tile Entities that extend this interface will get their own instance and it will be included along-side all of vanilla's pylons and any other modded pylons.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.CanChooseAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Calls each hook for the weapon, and each hook for the ammo,
then each corresponding hook in if applicable for the weapon and/or ammo, until one of them returns a concrete false value.
If all of them fail to do this, returns either true (if one returned true prior) or ammo.ammo == weapon.useAmmo.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.CanConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary:
Calls each hook for the weapon, and each hook for the ammo,
then each corresponding hook in if applicable for the weapon and/or ammo, until one of them returns a concrete false value.
If all of them fail to do this, returns true.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.OnConsumeAmmo(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: Calls for the weapon, for the ammo, then each corresponding hook for the weapon and ammo.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.UpdateArmorSet(Terraria.Player,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item,Terraria.Item)
member.summary: If the head's ModItem.IsArmorSet returns true, calls the head's ModItem.UpdateArmorSet. This is then repeated for the body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsArmorSet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.UpdateArmorSet with that string.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.PreUpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player's head texture's IsVanitySet returns true, calls the equipment texture's PreUpdateVanitySet. This is then repeated for the player's body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsVanitySet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.PreUpdateVanitySet, using player.head, player.body, and player.legs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.UpdateVanitySet(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player's head texture's IsVanitySet returns true, calls the equipment texture's UpdateVanitySet. This is then repeated for the player's body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsVanitySet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.UpdateVanitySet, using player.head, player.body, and player.legs.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.ArmorSetShadows(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: If the player's head texture's IsVanitySet returns true, calls the equipment texture's ArmorSetShadows. This is then repeated for the player's body, then the legs. Then for each GlobalItem, if GlobalItem.IsVanitySet returns a non-empty string, calls GlobalItem.ArmorSetShadows, using player.head, player.body, and player.legs.

member.summary: 调用 EquipTexture.SetMatch，然后调用所有 GlobalItem.SetMatch 钩子。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.CanRightClick(Terraria.Item)
member.summary: 调用 ModItem.CanRightClick，然后调用所有 GlobalItem.CanRightClick 钩子，直到其中一个返回 true。 如果其中一个返回 true，则返回 Main.mouseRight。否则，返回 false。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ItemLoader.RightClick(Terraria.Item,Terraria.Player)
member.summary: 如果 Main.mouseRightRelease 为 true，则执行以下步骤: 1. 调用 ModItem.RightClick 2. 调用所有的 GlobalItem.RightClick 钩子 3. 调用 ItemLoader.ConsumeItem，如果返回 true，则减少物品堆叠数量 4. 如果物品堆叠为 0，则将该物品的 type 变量设置为 0 5. 播放物品抓取声音 6. 将 Main.stackSplit 设置为 30 7. 将 Main.mouseRightRelease 设置为 false 8. 调用 Recipe.FindRecipes

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod
member.summary: Mod is an abstract class that you will override. It serves as a central place from which the mod's contents are stored. It provides methods for you to use or override.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.File
member.summary: The TmodFile object created when tModLoader reads this mod.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Code
member.summary:
The assembly code this is loaded when tModLoader loads this mod.
Do NOT call on this as it will error out if the mod uses the attribute to inherit from weakly referenced mods. Use instead.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Logger
member.summary: A logger with this mod's name for easy logging.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Name
member.summary: Stores the name of the mod. This name serves as the mod's identification, and also helps with saving everything your mod adds. By default this returns the name of the folder that contains all your code and stuff.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.TModLoaderVersion
member.summary: The version of tModLoader that was being used when this mod was built.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Version
member.summary: This version number of this mod.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ContentAutoloadingEnabled
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will autoload content by default. Autoloading content means you do not need to manually add content through methods.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GoreAutoloadingEnabled
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will automatically add images in the Gores folder as gores to the game, along with any ModGore classes that share names with the images. This means you do not need to manually call Mod.AddGore.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.MusicAutoloadingEnabled
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will automatically add music in the Sounds folder to the game. Place music tracks in Sounds/Music to autoload them.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.BackgroundAutoloadingEnabled
member.summary: Whether or not this mod will automatically add images in the Backgrounds folder as background textures to the game. This means you do not need to manually call Mod.AddBackgroundTexture.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Call(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Used for weak inter-mod communication. This allows you to interact with other mods without having to reference their types or namespaces, provided that they have implemented this method.
The Expert Cross Mod Content Guide explains how to use this hook to implement and utilize cross-mod capabilities.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.GetPacket(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a ModPacket object that you can write to and then send between servers and clients.
member.param: The capacity.
member.exception: Cannot get packet for " + Name + " because it does not exist on the other side

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Load
member.summary: 重写此方法以将大部分内容添加到您的模组中。 在这里您将调用其他方法，例如 AddItem。 这保证在所有内容都被自动加载后被调用。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PostSetupContent
member.summary: 允许您在主要内容设置后加载模组中的内容 (各种数组的长度已根据内容而调整)。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Unload
member.summary: 每当从游戏中卸载此模组时都会调用此方法。使用它来撤消您在 Load 中所做的未自动处理的更改(例如，对原版物品贴图的修改)。模组间的卸载顺序与加载顺序相反。

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.ExtraPlayerBuffSlots
member.summary: 该模组希望玩家获得的额外 Buff 槽数量。此值在 Mod.Load 之后但在 Mod.PostSetupContent 之前应用。玩家可以使用的实际增益数量为 22 加上所有已启用模组中此变量的最大值。在游戏中使用 Player.MaxBuffs 获取 Buff 的最大数量。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddRecipeGroups
member.summary: Override this method to add recipe groups to this mod. You must add recipe groups by calling the RecipeGroup.RegisterGroup method here. A recipe group is a set of items that can be used interchangeably in the same recipe.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.AddRecipes
member.summary: Override this method to add recipes to the game. It is recommended that you do so through instances of Recipe, since it provides methods that simplify recipe creation.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.PostAddRecipes
member.summary: This provides a hook into the mod-loading process immediately after recipes have been added. You can use this to edit recipes added by other mods.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.Close
member.summary: Close 在 Unload 之前调用，并且会在即将卸载模组时调用 (例如下载更新或重新编译时) 使用它来释放任何对其他文件的控制，或停止播放中的音乐。 确保在函数最后调用 `base.Close()` 可能在 Unload 调用之前被多次调用

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.Mod.HandlePacket(System.IO.BinaryReader,System.Int32)
member.summary: 每当从客户端(如果当前是服务器)或服务器(如果当前是客户端)接收到网络消息/数据包时调用。whoAmI是发送数据包的客户端的ID (相当于发送方的 Main.myPlayer, 由服务器发送到客户端的数据包中此值为 -1)，reader 变量用于读取数据包所含的二进制数据。
member.param: 用于从数据包读取数据的 BinaryReader 实例
发送该数据包的客户端(玩家)(由服务器发送到客户端的数据包中此值为 -1)

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot
member.summary: 一个 ModAccessorySlot 实例代表一个全新的配件槽实例。 您可以将字段存储在 ModAccessorySlot 类中。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.PreDraw(Terraria.ModLoader.AccessorySlotType,Terraria.Item,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2,System.Boolean)
member.summary: 允许在原版 ItemSlot.Draw 代码之前进行绘制。 返回 false 以不调用 ItemSlot.Draw

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.ApplyEquipEffects
member.summary:
重写以用您自己的替换插槽的原版效果行为。
默认调用：
- Player.VanillaUpdateEquips(FunctionalItem)
- Player.ApplyEquipFunctional(FunctionalItem, ShowVisuals)
- Player.ApplyEquipVanity(VanityItem)

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.CanAcceptItem(Terraria.Item,Terraria.ModLoader.AccessorySlotType)
member.summary:
用于设置是否允许将物品放置在该槽中的条件。 默认情况下，仅当物品属性 FitsAccessoryVanity 表明该物品无法进入时装栏时才返回 false。 返回 false 以阻止物品进入该槽。例如: 如果你想仅让染料能放进该槽，则对染料类物品返回 true。如果你想做个专门放翅膀的物品框，则对翅膀类物品返回 true 传入参数:
:: 正在尝试放入该槽的物品

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.ModifyDefaultSwapSlot(Terraria.Item,System.Int32)
member.summary: After checking for empty slots in ItemSlot.AccessorySwap, this allows for changing what the default target slot (accSlotToSwapTo) will be. DOES NOT affect vanilla behaviour of swapping items like for like where existing in a slot Return true to set this slot as the default targetted slot.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.IsHidden
member.summary: Override to control whether or not drawing will be skipped during the given frame. NOTE: Nothing will be drawn, nor will subsequent drawing hooks be called on this slot for the frame while true

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.IsEnabled
member.summary: Override to set conditions on when the slot is valid for stat/vanity calculations and player usage. Example: the demonHeart is consumed and in Expert mode in Vanilla.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.IsVisibleWhenNotEnabled
member.summary: Override to change the condition on when the slot is visible, but otherwise non-functional for stat/vanity calculations. Defaults to check 'property' IsEmpty

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModAccessorySlot.OnMouseHover(Terraria.ModLoader.AccessorySlotType)
member.summary: Allows you to do stuff while the player is hovering over this slot.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBackgroundStyle.Slot
member.summary: 该地下背景的ID

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModUndergroundBackgroundStyle
member.summary: Each background style determines in its own way how exactly the background is drawn. This class serves as a collection of functions for underground backgrounds.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModUndergroundBackgroundStyle.FillTextureArray(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Allows you to determine which textures make up the background by assigning their background slots/IDs to the given array. BackgroundTextureLoader.GetBackgroundSlot may be useful here. Index 0 is the texture on the border of the ground and sky layers. Index 1 is the texture drawn between rock and ground layers. Index 2 is the texture on the border of ground and rock layers. Index 3 is the texture drawn in the rock layer. The border images are 160x16 pixels, and the others are 160x96, but it seems like the right 32 pixels of each is a duplicate of the far left 32 pixels.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBackgroundStyle
member.summary: Each background style determines in its own way how exactly the background is drawn. This class serves as a collection of functions for above-ground backgrounds.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBackgroundStyle.ModifyFarFades(System.Single[],System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the transparency of all background styles that exist. In general, you should move the index equal to this style's slot closer to 1, and all other indexes closer to 0. The transitionSpeed parameter is what you should add/subtract to each element of the fades parameter. See the ExampleMod for an example.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBackgroundStyle.ChooseFarTexture
member.summary: Allows you to determine which texture is drawn in the very back of the background. BackgroundTextureLoader.GetBackgroundSlot may be useful here, as well as for the other texture-choosing hooks.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBackgroundStyle.ChooseMiddleTexture
member.summary: Allows you to determine which texture is drawn in the middle of the background.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBackgroundStyle.PreDrawCloseBackground(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch)
member.summary: Gives you complete freedom over how the closest part of the background is drawn. Return true for ChooseCloseTexture to have an effect; return false to disable tModLoader's own code for drawing the close background.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModSurfaceBackgroundStyle.ChooseCloseTexture(System.Single@,System.Double@,System.Single@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Allows you to determine which texture is drawn in the closest part of the background. This also lets you modify the scale and parallax (as well as two unfortunately-unknown parameters).
member.param: The scale.
The parallax value.
a?
b?

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBackgroundStyle
member.summary: This class serves to collect functions that operate on any kind of background style, without being specific to one single background style.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBackgroundStyle.ChooseUndergroundBackgroundStyle(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change which underground background style is being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBackgroundStyle.ChooseSurfaceBackgroundStyle(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change which surface background style is being used.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBackgroundStyle.FillUndergroundTextureArray(System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Allows you to change which textures make up the underground background by assigning their background slots/IDs to the given array. Index 0 is the texture on the border of the ground and sky layers. Index 1 is the texture drawn between rock and ground layers. Index 2 is the texture on the border of ground and rock layers. Index 3 is the texture drawn in the rock layer. The border images are 160x16 pixels, and the others are 160x96, but it seems like the right 32 pixels of each is a duplicate of the far left 32 pixels.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.GlobalBackgroundStyle.ModifyFarSurfaceFades(System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Single)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the transparency of all background styles that exist. The style parameter is the current style that is being used.

member.name: T:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBiome
member.summary: 此类代表由模组添加的群系。它的存在是为了集中各种与群系相关的钩子，并自动处理大量的群系设置。

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBiome.DisplayName
member.summary: 该群系在图鉴中显示的名称。

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBiome.BestiaryIcon
member.summary:
The path to the 30x30 texture that will appear for this biome in the bestiary. Defaults to adding "_Icon" onto the usual namespace+classname derived texture path.
Vanilla icons use a drop shadow at 40 percent opacity and the texture will be offset 1 pixel left and up from centered in the bestiary filter grid.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBiome.BackgroundColor
member.summary: 该群系的图鉴背景的颜色。

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBiome.IsSceneEffectActive(Terraria.Player)
member.summary: IsSceneEffectActive is auto-forwarded to read the result of IsBiomeActive. Do not need to implement when creating your ModBiome.

member.summary: This is where you can set values for DisplayName.

member.summary: Return true if the player is in the biome.

member.summary: Override this hook to make things happen when the player enters the biome.

member.summary:
The default style of sound made when this tile/wall is hit.
Defaults to SoundID.Dig, which is the sound used for tiles such as dirt and sand.

member.summary: The default type of dust made when this tile/wall is hit. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.ItemDrop
member.summary: The default type of item dropped when this tile/wall is killed. Defaults to 0, which means no item.

member.name: P:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.VanillaFallbackOnModDeletion
member.summary: The vanilla ID of what should replace the instance when a user unloads and subsequently deletes data from your mod in their save file. Defaults to 0.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.CreateMapEntryName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a ModTranslation object that you can use in AddMapEntry.

M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.GetMapOption(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows you to choose which minimap entry the tile/wall at the given coordinates will use. 0 is the first entry added by AddMapEntry, 1 is the second entry, etc. Returns 0 by default.

The y position in tile coordinates.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.KillSound(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows you to customize which sound you want to play when the tile/wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the game from playing its default sound for the tile/wall. Returns true by default.
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates.
The y position in tile coordinates.
If true, the tile/wall is only partially damaged. If false, the tile/wall is fully destroyed.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.NumDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to change how many dust particles are created when the tile/wall at the given coordinates is hit.
member.param: The x position in tile coordinates.
The y position in tile coordinates.
If true, the tile is spawning dust for reasons other than the tile actually being destroyed. Worms, projectiles, and other effects cause dust to spawn aside from the usual case of the tile breaking.
The number of dust that will be spawned by the calling code

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.CreateDust(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Allows you to modify the default type of dust created when the tile/wall at the given coordinates is hit. Return false to stop the default dust (the type parameter) from being created. Returns true by default.

The dust type that will be spawned by the calling code

member.summary: Allows you to stop this tile/wall from being placed at the given coordinates. Return false to stop the tile/wall from being placed. Returns true by default.

The y position in tile coordinates.

member.summary: Whether or not the tile/wall at the given coordinates can be killed by an explosion (ie. bombs). Returns true by default; return false to stop an explosion from destroying it.

member.name: M:Terraria.ModLoader.ModBlockType.RandomUpdate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called whenever the world randomly decides to update this tile/wall in a given tick. Useful for things such as growing or spreading.
